key_points: Prince Harry was seen playing fetch with his dog Pula on a Santa Barbara beach.
He appeared relaxed and casual, indicating he feels at home in Montecito.
Pula is a black Labrador rescued by Prince Harry and Meghan Markle after their wedding.
The dog's name, 'Pula,' has significance related to Botswana and denotes 'rain,' considered a blessing.
Pula featured during Meghan and Harry's interview with Oprah Winfrey, highlighting family life.
Meghan and Harry's family also includes Meghan's rescue beagle, Guy, and their son Archie.
A new video shared shows the family, including Pula and Archie, enjoying beach time together.
Meghan and Harry moved to Santa Barbara valuing the outdoor lifestyle for their family, especially for Archie.
Prince Harry mentioned the importance of outdoor activities like walks and beach visits for the family.
PEOPLE magazine offers exclusive Royals content featuring unseen photos and stories.
